COMMAND.name: ipv6 access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify IPv6 access list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to create IPv6 ACL and then enter IPv6 ACL configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If the system already has an IPv6 ACL with the same name, this command will enter the IPv6 ACL configuration mode. If the system already has an IP/MAC ACL with the same name, this command will not allowed to configure. When the name is not used by any IPv6 ACL, this command is to create the IPv6 ACL firstly and then enter the IPv6 ACL configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to create an IPv6 ACL named testacl and then enter the IPv6 ACL configuration mode. Switch(config)# ipv6 access-list testacl Switch(config-ipv6-acl-testacl)#

COMMAND.name: no ipv6 access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify a IPv6 access list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to remove this IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to remove the IPv6 ACL, and should detach IPv6 ACL from the interface which applied this IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to remove an IPv6 ACL named testacl. Switch(config)# no ipv6 access-list testacl

COMMAND.name: do
COMMAND.help: To run exec commands in config mode

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: remark
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to add remarks for the IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The remarks are up to 100 characters. The exceed parts will not be stored and will be truncated.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Default is no remarks of IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to add a remark to describe the IPv6 ACL. Switch(config-ipv6-acl-testacl)# remark aaaaaaa

COMMAND.name: no remark
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to delete remarks for the IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to delete remarks for the IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to delete the remark of the IPv6 ACL. Switch(config-ipv6-acl-testacl)# no remark

COMMAND.name: GACL

PARAM.name: src_mac
PARAM.help: Source host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: src_mac
PARAM.help: Source host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: dest_mac
PARAM.help: Destination host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: dest_mac
PARAM.help: Destination host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: src_ipv6_addrlen
PARAM.help: Source IPv6 address with mask length

PARAM.name: dest_ipv6_addrlen
PARAM.help: Destination IPv6 address with mask length

PARAM.name: flow-label
PARAM.help: Match packets with flow label value

PARAM.name: dscp
PARAM.help: Match packets with given dscp value

PARAM.name: dscp_value
PARAM.help: DSCP value, is the high 6 bit of traffic-class

PARAM.name: non-first-fragment
PARAM.help: Match packets with non first fragment

PARAM.name: non-or-first-fragment
PARAM.help: Match packets with non fragment or first fragment

PARAM.name: small-fragment
PARAM.help: Match packets that fragment offset is 1-3

PARAM.name: eq
PARAM.help: Match only packets on a given port number

PARAM.name: gt
PARAM.help: Match only packets with a greater port number

PARAM.name: lt
PARAM.help: Match only packets with a lower port number

PARAM.name: range
PARAM.help: Match only packets in the range of port number

PARAM.help: Match if all specified flags are present

PARAM.name: match-any

PARAM.name: icmp_type
PARAM.help: Specify value of the ICMP type

PARAM.name: icmp_code
PARAM.help: Specify value of the ICMP code

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to permit or deny packets matching the IPv6 filter.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to permit or deny packets matching the IPv6 filter.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to delete an IPv6 filter with sequence number 10 from an IPv6 ACL. Switch(config)# ipv6 access-list testacl Switch(config-ipv6-acl-testacl)# 10 permit src-ipv6 host 1:2::3:4

COMMAND.name: no sequence-num
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to delete a filter from IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to delete a filter from IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to delete an IPv6 filter with sequence number 10 from an IPv6 ACL. Switch(config-ipv6-acl-testacl)# no sequence-num 10

COMMAND.name: show ipv6 access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify a ipv6 access-list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the configuration of IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show the configuration of IPv6 ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: Switch# show ipv6 access-list ipv6 access-list testacl 10 permit src-ipv6 host 1:2::3:4

COMMAND.name: show statistic ipv6 access-list
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show statistic IPv6 access list.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show statistic IPv6 access list, interface need to be specified.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: Switch# show statistic ipv6 access-list eth-0-2 ipv6 access-list testacl in 10 permit src-ipv6 host 1:2::3:4 ( bytes 128 packets 1 ) (total bytes 128 total packets 1 )

COMMAND.name: clear statistic ipv6 access-list
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear statistic IPv6 access list.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to clear statistic IPv6 access list in or out or both.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: Switch# clear statistic ipv6 access-list both eth-0-2

COMMAND.name: ipv6 access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify a IPv6 access-list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to apply IPv6 ACL to interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to apply IPv6 ACL to interface, the IPv6 ACL should be created first.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to apply IPv6 ACL to interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-2 Switch(config-if-eth-0-2)# ipv6 access-list testacl in

COMMAND.name: no ipv6 access-list
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${direct_sub}" == "in" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/igs_ipv6_acl/ else cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/egs_ipv6_acl/ fi;
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to remove IPv6 ACL from interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to remove IPv6 ACL to interface, IPv6 ACL need not to be specified.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to apply IPv6 ACL to interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-2 Switch(config-if-eth-0-2)# no ipv6 access-list in
